sen.j: 吉田家（よしだけ）は卜部氏の流れを汲む堂上家である。
sen.e: The Yoshida family was a branch family of the Tosho Family descending from the Urabe clan.
OK
OK

sen.j: ここで記述する。
sen.e: Detailed in the section below:
OK
OK

sen.j: 吉田家（よしだけ）は藤原北家勧修寺流の公家。
sen.e: The Yoshida family was Kuge (a court noble family) from the Kanjuji line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
OK
OK

sen.j: 初代関東申次吉田経房や後の三房の一人吉田定房を輩出した。
sen.e: The Yoshida family produced Tsunefusa YOSHIDA, the first Kanto moshitsugi (court-appointed liaison with the bakufu) and Sadafusa YOSHIDA, one of three members of "Nochi no Sanbo".
OK
OK

sen.j: 後に嫡流は甘露寺藤長（定房の甥）の代に甘露寺家と改称。
sen.e: Later in the direct line of descendants, Fujinaga KANROJI (a nephew of Sadafusa YOSHIDA) assumed the Kanroji family name.
OK
OK

sen.j: 庶家に中御門家・坊城家・万里小路家・勧修寺家・穂波家・岡崎家・芝山家・清閑寺家などがある。
sen.e: During his period there were several family branches including: the Nakanomikado family, the Bojo family, the Madenokoji family, the Kajuji family, the Honami family, the Okazaki family, the Shibayama family, and the Seikanji family.
OK
OK

sen.j: 詳細については甘露寺家を参照のこと。
sen.e: For details, please refer to the Kanroji family.
OK
OK

sen.j: 吉田家（よしだや）は佐賀県唐津市（旧浜玉町）に実在した牛丼屋。
sen.e: "Yoshidaya" was a beef bowl shop that really existed in Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture (former Hamatama-cho).
"Yoshidaya" (吉田家) was a beef bowl shop that really existed in Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture (former Hamatama-cho).
sen.cmt: 「吉田屋」と区別するため漢字の注釈を入れました。
sen.e: "Yoshidaya" (吉田家) was a beef bowl shop that really existed in Karatsu City, Saga Prefecture (former Hamatama-cho).

sen.j: 元々はなわのヒット曲「佐賀県」に登場する「吉野家」をもじったフィクションであった。
sen.e: Originally, "Yoshidaya " was a fictional shop in a hit song of the "Saga Prefecture" by HANAWA; HANAWA made up the name "Yoshidaya " as a parody name for "Yoshinoya Co., Ltd".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: OK
OK

sen.j: が、2005年7月1日、はなわプロデュースにより本当にオープンした。
sen.e: HANAWA then proceeded to open the real shop, "Yoshidaya ", on July first, 2005.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: OK
OK

sen.j: 2006年9月25日をもって閉店した。
sen.e: The shop was closed on September 25, 2006.
OK
OK

sen.j: 吉田屋については、吉田屋を参照。
sen.e: Please refer to Yoshidaya for more about "Yoshidaya."
Please refer to Yoshidaya (吉田屋) for "Yoshidaya" (吉田屋).
sen.cmt: 「吉田家」と区別するため漢字の注釈を入れました。
sen.e: Please refer to Yoshidaya (吉田屋) for "Yoshidaya" (吉田屋).

sen.j: 吉田家（よしだけ）は卜部氏の流れを汲む堂上家である。
sen.e: The Yoshida family was a family branch of the Tosho Family, which descended from the Urabe clan.
OK
OK

sen.j: 吉田家の祖吉田兼煕は、室町にある自宅の敷地を足利義満に譲り、吉田神社の祠官であることに因み、家名を吉田とする。
sen.e: The founder of Yoshida family, Kanehiro YOSHIDA handed over his home premises in Muromachi to Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, and then he changed his family name to Yoshida, because he disliked being a Shinto priest of Yoshida-jinja Shrine.

The founder of Yoshida family, Kanehiro YOSHIDA handed over his home premises in Muromachi to Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, and he changed his family name to Yoshida, because he was a Shinto priest of Yoshida-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 「因み」の意味が正しく訳出されていなかったため修正。
sen.e: The founder of Yoshida family, Kanehiro YOSHIDA handed over his home premises in Muromachi to Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, and he changed his family name to Yoshida, because he was a Shinto priest of Yoshida-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 吉田兼煕は神祇官、侍従を務め、正三位に昇った。
sen.e: Kanehiro YOSHIDA had accomplished continuous promotions up to the official rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) after serving as Jingikan (department of worship) and then as jiju (a chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: OK
OK

sen.j: 堂上家の仲間入りを果たす。
sen.e: Because of his achievement, Kanehiro joined membership to Tosho Family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: OK
OK

sen.j: 更に吉田兼倶（従二位・神祇官）（1435年 - 1511年）は唯一神道（吉田神道）を足利将軍家及び公家に広めた。
sen.e: More over, Kanetomo YOSHIDA (Junii (Junior Second Rank), Jingikan) (1435-1511) spread Yuiitsu Shinto (One-and-Only Shinto) (Yoshida Shinto) to Ashikaga Shogun and Kuge.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, Kanetomo YOSHIDA (Junii [Junior Second Rank], Jingikan) (1435-1511) spread Yuiitsu Shinto (One-and-Only Shinto) (Yoshida Shinto) to Ashikaga Shogun and Kuge.
sen.cmt: スペルミス。英文にあわせて原文の区切りを修正しました。
sen.e: Moreover, Kanetomo YOSHIDA (Junii [Junior Second Rank], Jingikan) (1435-1511) spread Yuiitsu Shinto (One-and-Only Shinto) (Yoshida Shinto) to Ashikaga Shogun and Kuge.

sen.j: 神祇管領長上を自称し、これ以降は神祇官・白川家を押しのけ神社支配を強めていくこととなる。
sen.e: Afterward Kanetomo called himself Jingikanryochojo, Kanetomo with an emphasis on taking over Shrines to push Jingikan, the Shirakawa family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Kanetomo called himself Jingikanryochojo, and after that, Kanetomo increased his control on shrines pushing away Jingikan, the Shirakawa family.
sen.cmt: 「神祇管領長上」定訳不明です。
sen.e: Kanetomo called himself Jingikanryochojo, and after that, Kanetomo increased his control on shrines pushing away Jingikan, the Shirakawa family.

sen.j: そして神職における吉田家の優位は江戸時代になって寛文5年諸社禰宜神主法度の制定で確定する。
sen.e: During Edo period, predominance over Shinto priesthood Shinto priest of the Yoshida family was settled by the establishment of the shosha neki kannushi hatto (ordinances for shrine priests) in 1665.
During Edo period, predominance of the Yoshida family in Shinto priesthood was settled by the establishment of the shosha neki kannushi hatto (ordinances for shrine priests) in 1665.
During Edo period, predominance of the Yoshida family in Shinto priesthood was settled by the establishment of the shosha neki kannushi hatto (ordinances for shrine priests) in 1665.

sen.j: 江戸時代前期に、吉田家から萩原家が分かれ出た。
sen.e: At the early Edo period, the Hagiwara family established a new branch of the Yoshida family.
OK
OK

sen.j: 家格は半家_(公家)、歴代当主は神祇管領長上を称し、正二位・神祇官を極官とした。
sen.e: The family status of the Hagiwara family was hanke (lowest rank for toshoke) (kuge), and the successive family heads were called Jingikanryochojo, as their kyokkan (the highest rank which one was appointed) was Shonii and Jingikan.

The family status of the Hagiwara family was hanke (lowest rank for toshoke) (kuge), and the successive family heads were called Jingikanryochojo, as their kyokkan (the highest rank which one was appointed) was Shonii (Senior Second Rank) and Jingikan.

The family status of the Hagiwara family was hanke (lowest rank for toshoke) (kuge), and the successive family heads were called Jingikanryochojo, as their kyokkan (the highest rank which one was appointed) was Shonii (Senior Second Rank) and Jingikan.

sen.j: 江戸時代の家禄は760石。
sen.e: During Edo period, the Hagiwara family's Karoku (hereditary stipend) was 760 koku (approximately 136,800 liters of crop yield).
OK
OK

sen.j: 明治時代以降は子爵。
sen.e: After the Meiji period, the Hagiwara family was elevated to viscount.
OK
OK
